entry.title: [blinkpy] Narrow all-pass baseline equivalence
entry.content:
crrev.com/c/4385729 introduced "abbreviated all-pass baselines" to work

around incorrect baseline fallback. However, that change causes

`run_web_tests.py` to skip text comparison between two non-abbreviated

all-pass baselines, which can mask differences in present subtests.



Text comparison is now only skipped when the baseline is the abbreviated

all-pass baseline exactly.



Fixed: 1433714

Test: crbug.com/1433714#c0, add newlines to both `-expected.txt`

Test: Both tests now fail with "text diff by newlines only"

Change-Id: I37f49cbea04f510ab39199fe9a822000911cdc3d

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1145017}

entry.title: Plumb `initiator_frame_token` in CreateNavigationRequestFromEntry()
entry.content:
As preparation for [2], this CL plumbs initiator's

LocalFrameToken and process ID in

`NavigationControllerImpl::CreateNavigationRequestFromEntry()`

and its callers, so that [2] can rely sorely on the

initiator information.



For history traversals handled by

`CreateNavigationRequestFromEntry()`,

`History`'s relevant global object's associated Document

should be passed to `sourceSnapshotParams` [1], and its

`LocalFrameToken` is plumbed as `initiator_frame_token`

as expected, which is verified in [2] in

external/wpt/speculation-rules/prefetch/prefetch-traverse-reload.sub.html.



[1] https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/browsing-the-web.html#traverse-the-history-by-a-delta

[2] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4372403

entry.title: [Office upload] Authentication notification for opening ODFS files
entry.content:
Show system error notification when opening a ODFS file fails due to

reauthentication required. The notification has a "Sign in" button

that requests a new ODFS mount upon clicking. ODFS will unmount the old

mount if the authentication is successful in the new mount.



Add new function RequestODFSMount to share ODFS mount code between

CloudUploadPageHandler, cloud_upload_dialog.cc and soon:

CloudUploadNotificationManager.



Notification: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/AQKXZCAyHmYMFxs.png

entry.title: Refactor BubbleUIInfo constructors
entry.content:
We currently have three constructors for this class:

- A default BubbleUIInfo

- A BubbleUIInfo with a subpage

- A BubbleUIInfo with or without a progress bar



This prevents us from creating a row with both a subpage and a progress

bar, which is needed for deep scanning. This CL removes both non-default

constructors and replaces them with builder functions. This simplifies

existing callers with no subpage or progress bar, and adds minimal

additional complexity for adding a subpage or progress bar.

entry.title: [Extensions] Allow toggling messaging APIs in user script worlds
entry.content:
Allow configuring whether messaging APIs (including

chrome.runtime.connect(), chrome.runtime.sendMessage(),

chrome.runtime.onConnect, and chrome.runtime.onMessage) should be

exposed in a given user script world.



This will allow extensions to decide whether these APIs should be

availabe to a given user script world, which can help to further

reduce the risk of attacks via message passing.

entry.title: [EditContext] Ensure that EditContext gets detached when property is cleared
entry.content:
If the EditContext's associated element has focus, and the editContext

property is set to null, we fail to call Blur on the old EditContext.

This means that it's left as the InputMethodController's active

EditContext so it will continue to receive keyboard events.



Change Element::setEditContext to ensure that we'll always Blur the

old EditContext if one exists.

entry.title: [CR2023] Use MAC_DEFAULT on CQ bots
entry.content:
(quoted from bpastene@) The "mirrors = " field only causes the trybot to

pick up the CI bot's gclient configs + compile and test targets. System

level stuff like what OS it runs on doesn't get mirrored.



Fix this by specifying "os = os.MAC_DEFAULT" for the CQ bot.



Also removed the ineffective "schedule: " field and the comment on it.

entry.title: [iOS] Fix details of muted compromised password not updated after edit
entry.content:
This CL fixes a bug where editing a muted compromised password through

Password Checkup wouldn't entirely update the password's details view.

After editing, the "Restore Warning" button would still be available and

the compromised warning would also still be visible even if the new

password was not compromised.



The issue if fixed by updating the UI based on the compromised/muted

properties rather than the context in which the details page was

opened.



Fixed: 1445570

Change-Id: Ie9b6feed6e7827d320e4b721c80a3a65c2199aee

Reviewed-by: Tommy Martino

Commit-Queue: Noémie St-Onge

entry.title: [iOS] Password Issues dismissal after all issues are resolved/deleted
entry.content:
This CL simplifies the logic of the dismissal of the Password Issues

pages when they have no more issue to present. The logic is simplified

because, compared to what was done before, it fits every possible

scenario (i.e., password of the last issue was deleted, last password

issue was resolved by a password edit, last password issue was

dismissed). The approach taken in this CL is not the best UI-wise, but

it is the safest and only applies in edge cases. It also fixes crashes.

A better solution will be designed eventually.



Fixed: 1441425

entry.title: Introducing a new app usage telemetry periodic collector
entry.content:
This change introduces a new periodic collector for app usage telemetry

collection and reporting. This will only control the rate of collection

based on the new policy setting. This is to avoid data staleness because

we do not track timestamps with the telemetry data that is being

persisted in the pref store today. The observer component will perform

necessary validation on allowed types before it persists data in the

pref store.



I will be renaming the AppUsageCollector and all its references

following this change for better distinction in component

responsibilities.



Bug: b:260803048

Change-Id: Idcfd0c428c47086d45527026a8d49743351f9f9d

entry.title: Improve hover triggering functionality to support popover=manual
entry.content:
This CL primarily adds a much larger hover hiding test, which tests

all popover types, two invoker types, and all popovertargetaction

values. In building that, I found a number of cases that weren't

properly handled, mostly because hover detection was using a version

of IsNodePopoverDescendant that was fairly manual and old. This

new version makes better use of a newly-expanded

FindTopmostRelatedPopover which is able to optionally look at manual

popovers. In doing this, I also refactored the `inclusive` argument

into an EnumSet to allow controlling the manual popover behavior

at the same time.



Bug: 1416284

Fixed: 1443372

Fixed: 1445580

entry.title: Revert "Price Drop Notification URL Handler for backgrounded multi window iPad"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 0782f29aaf8f929ac063aeccabbf3f157faacc73.



Reason for revert: crbug.com/1445798



Original change's description:

> Price Drop Notification URL Handler for backgrounded multi window iPad

>

> The price drop notification URL handler does not work for multi window

> iPad when the app is backgrounded. This CL updates the hooks used

> and has been verified works for all use cases (iPhone, iPad, single

> window, multi window, foreground, background, re-open after closed).

> It uses UIApplicationDidBecomeActiveNotification as a signal for

> the browser objects being available instead of InitStageFinal in

> AppStateObserver. It also uses a browser with its scene activation

> level SceneActivationLevelForegroundInactive instead of just the

> first active browser seen as a fallback in the event a browser

> with scene state activation level of

> SceneActivationLevelForegroundActive is not found.

>

> Bug: b:267630688

> Change-Id: Id462553c3188b4d5dd9ea263cef5f73a9e403c50

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4523582

> Commit-Queue: David Maunder

> Reviewed-by: Mark Cogan

entry.title: Revert "Reland "Android CCV/CRS: Turn on ChromeRootStoreUsed in fieldtial_testing_config.json""
entry.content:
This reverts commit 212497b77f6a41b5263570aca1ac78b638996537.



Reason for revert: Causing android-arm-tests to fail chrome_test_apk with "EmbeddedTestServer$EmbeddedTestServerFailure: Failed to install root certificate"



Original change's description:

> Reland "Android CCV/CRS: Turn on ChromeRootStoreUsed in fieldtial_testing_config.json"

>

> This reverts commit 3cab5ea4a21787927909463aa527e4ea4ebe0dbd.

>

> Reason for revert: Original change broke internal bots when code was run statically on class load; moving back to a ClassHook implementation.

>

> Original change's description:

> > Revert "Android CCV/CRS: Turn on ChromeRootStoreUsed in fieldtial_testing_config.json"

> >

> > This reverts commit c55272f6365bb00ba1c260064c66dc6777f094c2.

> >

> > Reason for revert: Broke internal bots

> > https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1442472

> >

> > Original change's description:

> > > Android CCV/CRS: Turn on ChromeRootStoreUsed in fieldtial_testing_config.json

> > >

> > > This required modifying tests to ensure that the test root is loaded in X509Utils.java via a ClassHook in ContentJUnit4ClassRunner before the user-added roots are pulled in net/cert/internal/trust_store_android.cc, so that the chrome cert verifier would correctly verify trust for connections to the EmbeddedTestServer. Previous attempts to do this did this at other points in the test loading process, but were unsuccessful for a variety of different reasons, usually in loading the root too late.

> > >

> > > We also rely on the fact that the root cert for EmbeddedTestServer is a statically checked in file (at net/data/ssl/certificates/root_ca_cert.pem) as the current solution (starting up the EmbeddedTestServer in a separate APK + calling to get the root cert) requires calling into native code which can't be done easily before the chrome cert verifier loads the user-added roots.

> > >

> > > This would be easier if the EmbeddedTestServer was run in process instead of in its own APK; I don't know if it would be feasible or how much work it would be to change this.

> > >

> > > Change-Id: Ie035190666dfe32ec7b13d66792ff6cbd7b3c1e7

entry.title: updater: remove aggressive CHECK from task scheduler code.
entry.content:
CHECKs on runtime conditions are not desirable since the value of such

runtime condition is not an invariant source of truth that can be reasoned about in our program.



Further CLs will change the function declaration to avoid passing pointer parameters where possible to reduce the number of CHECKs even more.

entry.title: Don't use AbortSignal::Follow in fetch and cache-storage
entry.content:
AbortSignal's "follow" algorithm is replaced with a new algorithm for

creating a dependent abort signal ([1], [2]), which is implemented as

a new AbortSignal constructor. This CL replaces Follow with the new

ctor, behind the AbortSignalAny REF.



There is a slight compat risk with the change (when the feature ships):

1. fetch: abort is propagated to dependent signals after abort event

dispatch for a signal, whereas "follow" propagated abort before (as

abort algorithms), which is observable. We could alternatively use

weak abort algorithms in AbortSignal.any(), but that would be more

complicated and partially limit GC optimizations.



2. cache: The use of "follow" in cache.addAll was not specced and

could lead to abort events firing when they shouldn't have. The new

behavior preserves the specced behavior (aborting outstanding

requests on failure) without dispatching events when abort is

triggered internally.



Note: the virtual test expectations match the current expectations

except for the test modified in fetch/api/abort/general.any.js.



[1] https://github.com/whatwg/dom/pull/1152

[2] https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/pull/1646



Bug: 1323391

Low-Coverage-Reason: the uncovered lines in request.cc are covered by WPT tests

entry.title: Reland "[Android] Sync CachedFlags declared with listed in ChromeCachedFlags"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 4877e5a41e14851b264a1d9c111ad11d69c664cd



Test case for revert was already flaky. Not this CL's fault.



Original change's description:

> [Android] Sync CachedFlags declared with listed in ChromeCachedFlags

>

> There are some CachedFlags in ChromeFeatureList which are not listed

> in ChromeCachedFlags, which means their value is not cached (but past

> cached values are still used, so it may be useful in this corner case

> if they were at some point in ChromeCachedFlags).

>

> This CL:

> - Cleans up some launched flags that aren't being cached:

> - CCTAllowCrossUidActivitySwitchFromBelow

> - PartnerHomepageInitialLoadImprovement

> - Starts caching a flag that is not currently cached but seems like

> it should

> - BackGestureRefactorActivityAndroid

> - Removes some CachedFlags that were only declared presumably because

> they had related cached field trial params (in this case it's not

> required to cache the flag itself)

> - LensCameraAssistedSearch

> - OmahaMinSdkVersionAndroid

> - Removes a completely unused CachedFlag

> - PrefetchNotificationSchedulingIntegration

>

> -

entry.title: [Mac Ventura Views] Track contentView when attaching a NativeView
entry.content:
When attaching Widget A to Widget B using NativeViewHost, the NativeViewHost machinery makes Widget A's native_view_ a subview of

Widget B's native_view_. A widget's native_view_ is also the

contentView of its native NSWindow, and this reparenting didn't remove

the native_view_ from its originating window (it simply added the

native_view_ to this new view hierarchy). In previous versions of

macOS, it appears the AppKit wouldn't notice that Widget A's window

contentView was now also a subview in a second window's NSView tree.

As of macOS Ventura, it appears the AppKit does take notice, setting

Widget A's window contentView to nil.



Widget focus traversal depends on a Widget's contentView's

connection to its original window, so reparenting a widget breaks

several tests on Ventura. This cl addresses the problem by storing a

reference to a widget's contentView before removing it from its original window.



Test: out/Default/views_unittests \

--gtest_filter=FocusTraversalTest*:NativeViewHostMacTest.*NativeViewReferenceOn*

out/Default/browser_tests \

--gtest_filter=ImmersiveModeControllerMacBrowserTest.ToggleFullscreen



Bug: 1414941

Change-Id: I36dbb30b48105b4d3d54d336fdb5b465ecc62b93

entry.title: crash-fix:Remove OnThemeChanged override
entry.content:
There is a crash with BluetoothDetailedViewLegacy, which is

a TrayDetailedView.



TrayDetailedView:::AddScrollListSubHeader() (and other util functions) add a view to the view hierarchy, and stores a ptr to that view (and a

few others). The function also returns a ptr to that same view, which

BluetoothDetailedViewLegacy caches.



Later on, BTDetailedViewLegacy removes the cached view from the view

hierarchy, but the base class TrayDetailedView still has that ptr saved

and it is not updated.



This leads to a crash in TrayDetailedView::OnThemeChanged, and this

is fixed in this CL by removing the OnThemeChanged function, and the

cached pointers. We can do this because we can just set color ID's which will allow the views to update their own colors without us keeping ptrs

to them.



The underlying issue of BTDetailedViewLegacy caching and removing views

without updating the base class still exists, and we should fix this,

but not in this CL.



Bug: b:251762547

Change-Id: I246b03c33b31b114152fa19417402bdfbcb272ad

entry.title: Anchored Nudges Dismiss timer
entry.content:
Add a `dismiss_timers_` map in AnchoredNudgeManager that maintains a

timer per nudge used to dismiss them on timeout. The timer is only

initialized for those nudges whose duration is not set to be infinite.



Also added a HoverObserver class in AnchoredNudge that calls a delegate

method in the manager, so the nudge's dismiss timer can be stopped and

restarted when the user hovers over the nudge.



Bug: b:279654077, b:281159642

entry.title: overview: Fix issue with overview clip not removed when combining desks
entry.content:
This bug would occur whenever combining desks with non-chrome windows

in overview. Combining desks will remove the existing overview items,

then add them back with the associated desk.



Removing the item will trigger a clip animation to reshow the header.

Since we want an animation, we have to animate the clip to the size

of the window, then remove it after the animation ends, so we have

an intermediate clip.



By removing the existing overview item, and then adding it back, the

target clip is actually the intermediate clip. For this case, removing

the clip (as well as transform and opacity) with animation has no

visually differences so the fix is on combine, we remove the items

without animation.



Test: manual, ash_unittests *OverviewSessionTest.WindowClippingAfterCombiningDesks*

Change-Id: I828ba93e63bc33f09584d6ceeb7b1924f2266854

Fixed: b/282010852

entry.title: [Android] Replace ShadowPaymentFeatureList
entry.content:
With PaymentFeatureList using the generic FeatureMap, we can now set

overrides using the @Enable/DisableFeatures annotations and the

FeatureList.TestValues API.



Create DefaultPaymentFeatureConfig to keep the functionality of a

default configuration for unit tests and add an

FeatureList#mergeTestValues() API to allow setting test values

programmatically without overriding previous values set by the

annotation processor.



This needs to be a 3-sided patch because of downstream usage of

ShadowPaymentFeatureList. Will send a follow-up to remove

ShadowPaymentFeatureList once the downstream usages are replaced.

entry.title: Update rounded corners of help bubbles in Ash.
entry.content:
In Ash, help bubbles have corner radius of 16dp except for the corner

closest to the help bubble's anchor which has a corner radius of 2dp,

provided the help bubble and its anchor are not center aligned.



This CL updates the Ash fork of help bubble views to use the desired

rounded corners as well as fixes a bug in `views::BubbleBorder` which

did not paint the bubble background correctly when custom rounded

corners were applied.



Note that this CL also removes support for visible arrows in the Ash

fork of help bubble views since visible arrows are not part of the UX

spec for Ash.



Before `views::BubbleBorder` fix: http://shortn/_aSsosLEHUI

After `views::BubbleBorder` fix: http://shortn/_27ofwbAazt



New Benchmark Images: http://shortn/_ojDdTkrhKS

entry.title: [EditContext] Add fallback to selection bounds in EditContext::FirstRectForCharacterRange
entry.content:
In EditContext::FirstRectForCharacterRange, if the composition character

bounds are not available, fall back to the selection bounds

before falling back to the control bounds.



The existing fallback to the control bounds can result in poor IME

positioning if the control bounds are large; using selection

should generally be preferable as the selection will tend to be

close to the active composition.

entry.title: Allow for redirects to change the network context of a prefetch.
entry.content:
This CL adds support for redirect that require a different network

context than the previous URL of the prefetch. For these types of

redirect, the previous PrefetchStreamingURLLoader is stopped, and a new

PrefetchStreamingURLLoader is used to request the redirect URL in the

appropriate network context.

entry.title: RELAND: media/gpu/v4l2: Remove BufferAffinityTracker
entry.content:
Original CL broke lacros-arm-archive-rel bot, probably because

I wrote GUARDED_BY() when I should have used GUARDED_BY_CONTEXT

instead. Concrete error was:



../../media/gpu/v4l2/v4l2_device.h:538:18: error: use of undeclared identifier 'sequence_checker_'

GUARDED_BY(sequence_checker_);



PS0 contains the reverted CL, subsequent patches the fixes.



Original CL description -----------------------------------------------



BufferAffinityTracker is supposed to be a wrapper around a map

(from id to a correlative index 0... max size). There're

multiple strangenesses in that class: Method naming and comments

don't follow Chromium convention, uses an unnecessary lock, and

more importantly it carries out a simple map operation behind a

complicated class (which only has a use site).



This CL removes said class and moves the logic directly to its only user. Note how mutual exclusion condition is enforced at compile

time via GUARDED_BY(sequence_checker_).



Bug: b:279980150

Change-Id: Ie378eb1377f935b70643a70b76178758c844917d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4519943

Reviewed-by: Nathan Hebert

Commit-Queue: Miguel Casas-Sanchez

entry.title: [Topics] Consolidate PrefetchURLLoaderService and BrowsingTopicsURLLoaderService
entry.content:
What: consolidate Prefetch & Topics URLLoaderService into a

single SubresourceProxyingURLLoaderService.



Why:

- It reduces the number of renderer->browser Mojo channels.

Offline testing shows that this improves ~30 KB

Memory.Browser.PrivateMemoryFootprint for each frame.

- This makes it easier to extend functions: future features (and

the pre-existing KeepAlive factory) can all be consolidated into

this service -- no need to plumb a new factory through layers

each time.

- This also makes it possible to stack different types of

requests (e.g. keep-alive & topics, when the keep-alive service

gets consolidated as well).



Bug: 1444215

Change-Id: Iccee1ff169b6611ec47a9312642e805fd6d9edb1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4520622

Commit-Queue: Yao Xiao

entry.title: capture-game: Starts the client session on session init completed
entry.content:
This CL adds callback in `CaptureModeController::Start()` to be

invoked anytime when the state of the session initialization process

is determined. Client session can only start if it's informed to

proceed.

This is necessary since the client session initialization and the

capture session initialization are asynchronous, and the client

session needs to be informed whether to proceed or not when the

session initialization is completed.



Fixed: b/281763025

Reason for revert: Speculative revert for testParentalControlsProviderDelayed test failure



Original change's description:

> [Android] Sync CachedFlags declared with listed in ChromeCachedFlags

>

> There are some CachedFlags in ChromeFeatureList which are not listed

> in ChromeCachedFlags, which means their value is not cached (but past

> cached values are still used, so it may be useful in this corner case

> if they were at some point in ChromeCachedFlags).

>

> This CL:

> - Cleans up some launched flags that aren't being cached:

> - CCTAllowCrossUidActivitySwitchFromBelow

> - PartnerHomepageInitialLoadImprovement

> - Starts caching a flag that is not currently cached but seems like

> it should

> - BackGestureRefactorActivityAndroid

> - Removes some CachedFlags that were only declared presumably because

> they had related cached field trial params (in this case it's not

> required to cache the flag itself)

> - LensCameraAssistedSearch

> - OmahaMinSdkVersionAndroid

> - Removes a completely unused CachedFlag

> - PrefetchNotificationSchedulingIntegration

>

entry.title: Initialize PDF SDK with policy in `chrome_pdf::ConvertPdf*()`
entry.content:
This CL sets a global enterprise policy variable from callers of

`chrome_pdf::ConvertPdfPagesToNupPdf()` and `chrome_pdf::ConvertPdfDocumentToNupPdf()` before they are called, so

that `ScopedSdkInitializer()` can initialize PDF SDK based on the enterprise policy.



- Adds a new method `SetUseSkiaRendererPolicy()` to `PdfNupConverter`

so that the policy value can be passed from the browser process to

the printing services.

- Adds a global variable `g_use_skia_renderer_enabled_by_policy` in

pdf.cc so that it can store the enterprise policy status and be used

by `ScopedSdkInitializer()`.

- Adds TODO comments for `ScopedSdkInitializer()` direct callers which

still need access to the enterprise policy values.



Bug: 1440430

Change-Id: Iac1c75906c3ab304d6ec396de3c5d3b2f196ee98

entry.title: Anchored Nudge Manager pt.1
entry.content:
Base implementation of AnchoredNudgeManager, which is used to keep track

and manage all nudges that are currently on screen. It can be accessed

from feature code through a static getter, and is used to create, show

and dismiss anchored nudges.



Design doc: go/anchored-nudges

- Update arrow when re-anchoring (e.g. when shelf alignment changes)

entry.title: [CrOS WiFi] Add static config structure for DHCP cases
entry.content:
In cases where name servers and ip config type aren't set to static, we

were sending an empty static config structure to shill. This meant that

even in cases where there are no changes made to name servers, any

unrelated change (for ex: auto connect to network) would end up sending

empty static config to shill and that was overwriting earlier saved

preferences.



Fixing this bug by sending empty static config only in cases where the

ip config and name server type is explicitly set to DHCP.



Bug: b/277130013

Change-Id: I58beb3c47759893ec9bca75f6fc7dfa76df89d9a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4520766

Reviewed-by: Steven Bennetts

entry.title: Fix WebDatabase presubmit script.
entry.content:
While refactoring, some types slipped in that make the script fail even

for valid changes (such as crrev.com/c/4505975, where I discovered the

problem). This CL fixes the typos:

- The path contained a double slash. Since paths are compared using

string equality, the relevant file is not found.

- In a regex, the capture group is not set correctly, causing the

wrong contents to be extracted.



Since there are no unit tests for presubmit scripts, this slipped. My

manual testing/the screenshots of crrev.com/c/4519274 were made before

the "no-op refactorings".



Now, the presubmit script passes for valid changes - as is apparent by

the fact that I can upload the parent CL :)



Change-Id: Ie29254903ce177e29af53d14b4fa141489629218

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4539302

Commit-Queue: Florian Leimgruber

Reviewed-by: Peter Kasting
